items.content_html: Music: Another one of the joys of being a dad.
Radio Free Boulder Colorado is back on the air. Turns out that replacing a battery in an early 2013 is difficult, but doable. And bonus - I think I have a topic to blog about this week.
I am in it now :-)
The battery replacement kit is out for delivery. Now I just need to work up the courage to crack open a perfectly useable vintage/obsolete MBP and take its beating heart into my untrained hands. üíª
Driving in today the thermostat went from 3 degrees to 6 degrees. Spring has come to Colorado.
Apparently, I live in a Bob Ross painting.

I noticed a new favicon appeared on my hosted site today and was dismayed to see it didn‚Äôt have a transparent background. So I updated my my gravatar image, and et voil√†, the site was updated in minutes. I ‚ù§Ô∏è micro.blog.

I walked into my local Apple store today to see about getting the battery replaced in my early 2013 Macbook Pro and the kid in the store called it ‚Äúvintage, if not obsolete.‚Äù Apparently, my only option is third party shops because they wont touch it. Grrr.
Today I witnessed Starman sitting in his Tesla on the way to Mars. What a great moment to be alive. üöÄ
When Two Tribes Go To War - Andrew Sullivan. +1 for the Frankie Goes to Hollywood reference.
Wall of beer
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt always succeed. But I want to. And I believe everyone else ‚Äì for some reasonable statistical value of everyone else ‚Äì fundamentally does, too.‚Äù - Coding Horror
I saw a Random Rock of Kindness on today‚Äôs hike. I hope this bodes well for the new year.

items.title: On Boxing Day
items.content_html: My memory this day will be of waking up early on a foggy morning, drinking hot coffee and watching the EPL, children constructing legos and playing with toys while the cat does his best to turn himself into a cinnamon roll on the couch, and the snow. The snow came as a pleasant suprise today after the crush of activity around Christmas. In other words, it‚Äôs fine day to relax the mind and take life in for a change. Working in information and software often takes it toll in the amount of mind share we give to the real world and as I begin to engage more with this microblog of mine I want to capture this stuff. Years from now I wont remember what project I was doing this month, but I hope I remember the warmth of this day.
Christmas Eve‚Ä¶
Christmas lights at Denver Botanic Gardens
Temptation
Has banning words ever worked out for the people trying to ban them before? Asking for a friend.

items.title: Getting started halfway through my first year on micro.blog
items.content_html:
Just finished the last major release of the year at work and now I am thinking about what I want to do with this ole blog. For many months now I have dabbled on and off, and played with some formatting and tested pages, but I haven‚Äôt started, not really.

One of the reasons I backed micro.blog is that I liked the idea of simply writing more, and writing more simply without all the baggage that comes with social networks. I started this year by walking away from my facebook account because it felt unhealthy to me. And almost a year on, it‚Äôs reaffirming to read articles that advance those feelings in tangible ways. So what is the difference with micro.blog? I think the difference is captured in something Manton wrote about owning your own short form writing. Owning your words, and paying a nominal fee to be read (assuming anyone does this), simply feels better. Ownership is something that comes with a price and perhaps that is one of the ways to keep ourselves writing from a place of humility, empathy, and simplicity. I confess I was not always happy with the person I was on facebook and I hope to be better if I should keep this up.

My hope is that I create some body of writing that has value to me. In the same way photos become a stanchion of memory, my writing may help me to remember. Or perhaps I will write something of value to others. I have no idea, but it will be interesting to do this and see what happens.

So what do I do now? I guess the answer is to get started‚Ä¶
Moon over Table Mountain
Thanksgiving hike 2017
Seen at work this morning.
Early morning on the pitch.
Hazy Labor Day morning
Long live Steely Dan‚Ä¶
